metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5747 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in BusyBox through 1.30.0. An out of bounds read in udhcp components (consumed by the DHCP client, server, and/or relay) might allow a remote attacker to leak sensitive information from the stack by sending a crafted DHCP message. This is related to assurance of a 4-byte length when decoding DHCP_SUBNET. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2018-20679.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5747` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
busybox-static - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
udhcpc - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
udhcpd - 1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: busybox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.27.2-2ubuntu5').
